glsa.title: FreeType: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in FreeType allowing for user-assisted remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: FreeType is a True Type Font rendering library.

description.p: Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs has discovered an integer overflow in the function bdfReadCharacters() when parsing BDF fonts.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to use a specially crafted BDF font, possibly resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow and the remote execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All FreeType users should upgrade to the latest version:
